utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I thought this was going to be a small gathering. I mean, there’s enough food in here for like, fifty people.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Never underestimate the importance of leftovers. Second day stuffing, turkey soup, microwave yams, and a visit to the food bank.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And just to let you know, Alexis always makes dessert. Pi said he would make a cranberry concoction of some kind. Even Mother cooks something. It’s not always edible.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: I heard that!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you know what, I make a killer stuffing. And my dad makes a great traditional corn casserole.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice. And I know the perfect costume for you so you don’t have to worry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A costume?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m going to be Senator John Rolfe, so you obviously will be Pocahontas, his bride. Alexis goes back and forth. Sometimes she’s Puritan, sometimes she’s Native American, it just depends on where she is in her life. Your dad can be whichever. Nothing elaborate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … you guys – you guys dress up for Thanksgiving?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doesn’t everybody?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I think that’s pretty special to you. Um … so, is there anything else I need to know about you before we get married?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So many, many things.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s been a murder in a church downtown.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, too bad it wasn’t in a cathedral. That would be so T.S Elliott. Huh? Murder in a cathedral? Thomas Beckett? Beckett and Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When we do this, let’s not do the dead body in the middle of the aisle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Good call. So what happened?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Well, our victim entered the church during 6:30 mass with multiple gunshot wounds, made his way toward the alter before collapsing.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But not before handing the priest a little something something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A baby!

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: A boy. I’m guessing he’s about three months. And he’s hungry because he keeps going after the girls.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, who can blame him? Hi, buddy. What’s your name, little man?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That is a very good question.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So is this the baby’s father?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We don’t really know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But what we do know is his name is Cameron Ducane, 30, lived in the Bronx. There’s no baby pictures in his wallet, he’s got a commercial driver’s license, probably drives for a living. He’s got a car wash coupon– – and like Ryan, spent his hard earned money on a lottery ticket.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That is the Five State Magic Ball Jackpot. At $247 million you’re crazy not buying a ticket.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, one or two. Not fifty.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m just increasing my odds of winning.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re increasing your odds of being broke.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Listen, do you have any idea what it costs raising a child in New York City?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know how much it costs. I mean -

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Of course you don’t, ‘cause you don’t -

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys! How about we don’t fight in front of the baby?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, contact Ducane’s next of kin. Let’s see if this little guy is indeed his.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then what happens to him in the meantime?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we’ll get ahold of child services and they’ll place him until we’re able to get him back to his family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think Lanie’s right. He is hungry. Um … how about you finish up here. I’ll grab a uniform and we’ll just go pick up some stuff for him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You really want to do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. I’m highly qualified. I have an RHD in childcare.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And an RHD is?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ruggedly handsome dad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, buddy. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t look at her. C’mon. We’ll get ice cream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do we know where he was shot?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uniforms found it with the engine running and both doors wide open.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone fired on him from above, through the roof. That’s a lot of blood.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Notice what’s missing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no car seat.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whatever happened, I don’t think he planned on having a baby with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And there’s no way of telling how long he had been driving. I mean, he could have been shot nearby.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or miles away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, have uniforms go through traffic cam footage. Let’s see if we can figure out what direction this car was coming from.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. We found the victim’s wife. It’s not their kid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could the baby be a friend’s or a relative’s?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, I know this is hard, but is it possible that Cam had a baby outside your marriage?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Where’d he go this morning? Do you know what he was doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did he go in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … did you notice anything unusual in his life recently? Anything that would point to trouble in his life of some sort?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he say why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This limo company, what’s the name?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: Cameron? Geez, he’s one of my best guys. Nice, reliable, good soul. What happened?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We were hoping you could tell us.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We know he worked the overnight yesterday. What time did he finish his shift this morning?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: He didn’t. He was on the books to work last night but he didn’t show up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He do that a lot?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: Nah, in a year and a half here that was his first time.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You notice anything going on with him at work? Anything unusual?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. There was that guy that showed up last week. Watch yourself. Guys, bring it out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What guy?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: Well Cam said he was an old friend, right? But they didn’t look too friendly to me. When Cam saw him he went pale and they stepped outside to talk. And it sounded pretty heated.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know what it was about?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: No, but I heard the guy say something about going to prison. When Cam came back inside he was rattled. And before that guy left he told Cam that he’d be coming back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This guy show up again?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: No, but I got the feeling that Cam was scared of him because normally he’d come back to the garage for his 3AM lunch break, but since that guy showed up he’d be staying out all night like he was scared to come back here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This guy? Can you describe him?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: I didn’t really get a look at his face, but oh, oh, oh. Yeah, yeah, yeah. He had this tattoo on his arm. It was pretty spectacular. It was a wolf, teeth bared, howling at a moon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow, a howling wolf tattoo? That’s pretty specific.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If this guy did time, there should be a record of it in the prison tattoo database.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Esposito’s checking right now. Any idea who’s kid this is?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, there’s no reports of missing babies.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. How about our victim?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, aside from a handful of speeding tickets back in the day, he’s clean. All of his friends say he was quiet, he was hardworking, and completely devoted to his wife.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A guy takes off for work at 10PM and never arrives. And then at 6:45 the next morning he shows up shot to death at a church, holding someone else’s baby. What the hell happened in those 8 hours?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. So … that’s a couple of things?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I just grabbed the essentials. You know, diapers, a carrier, wipes, blankies, bottles, formula. Didn’t want little Cosmo going hungry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cosmo, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Can’t just keep calling him ‘the baby’.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, why Cosmo?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s what I was going to call Alexis if she was a boy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A turkey outfit? Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a turkey onesie. It’s Thanksgiving. It was expensive, but it’s adorable. Like I said, my family dresses up for Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m suddenly getting a clear and frightening visual as to what my future will look like.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Castle. …um, mind if I hold him? It’ll be good experience for me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Absolutely. Ready?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hold his head, there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hold him up under his –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um… he’s crying. What am I doing wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just try to remain calm. They can sense fear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is not at all like the practice doll.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I thought I was ready. Clearly I am not. Oh God, I’m not ready.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh he really likes you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yeah. I don’t know if you know this about me. Babies love me. I’m the baby whisperer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Want to hold him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. I’d rather figure out where he came from.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, when a man –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stop. Stop. I know where babies come from, Castle. Just not this one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t believe you don’t want to hold the baby. Everyone wants to hold the baby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t want to hold that baby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So I got a hit in the prison tattoo database. Check it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just like Roman described it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep. Belongs to one Jimmy Wolfinsky, aka Jimmy the Wolf. Suspected in a handful of bank and jewelry jobs, he was arrested seven years ago and convicted when a bank robbery went south. He just got paroled two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any connection to our victim?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the bank that he robbed? Jimmy would have gotten away but when he came outside the building his getaway car was gone. Jimmy’s partner bolted when the alarm sounded. Cops never caught him and Jimmy never ratted, but witnesses were able to provide a sketch of the driver. Look familiar?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Cameron Ducane, our victim.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Our mild-mannered limo driver had a criminal past.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like his past just caught up with him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So it’s a tale of betrayal and revenge. Cameron abandons his partner Jimmy he comes down, leaving him to take the fall. Ridden with remorse, Cameron tries to put it all behind him, start life anew. But surprise, surprise. Jimmy made parole after spending seven long years thinking of ways to make his partner pay.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No wonder Cameron was adding locks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He didn’t want to tell his wife about it because he didn’t want her to know about his criminal past.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well that’s a great theory, Castle, except where did the baby come from?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, maybe … nope, I’ve got nothing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I just talked to Jimmy the Wolf’s parole officer. Jimmy’s got an apartment in Queens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Head up there. See if you can track him down. Whatever happened last night, he was a part of it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t you worry, little Cosmo. These guys are the best. If anyone can find your folks, it’s them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except we have double checked with hospitals, the FBI, and the NCMEC and nothing. If someone was missing their baby wouldn’t they have come forward?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe they don’t know he’s gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or maybe they’re not alive. I mean, we don’t know what happened that night.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, whatever happened happened near that church.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I had some information and I thought I’d come by and check on my little patient. Hey little doodlebug. How’re you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What makes you think Cameron was shot near the church?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, based on the nature and the severity of the wounds, your victim maybe had only five or ten minutes before he bled out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He couldn’t have driven that far.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Twenty blocks at most. I also found something unusual under his fingernails. Wax residue, charred nitrocellulose, and camphor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nitrocellulose?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yes. It’s used to make celluloid. You can find it in old filmstock, certain kinds of plastic, but it’s highly flammable. Isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Charred celluloid? Where would that come from?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Beats me. That’s your job. Right now my job is to play with the little baby. Yes it is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, Jimmy’s apartment is empty and his landlord hasn’t seen him in days.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well if he killed Cameron he’s probably halfway to Mexico by now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, I’ll put out a BOLO on him and check in with his parole officer, see if he’s got a list of known associates. He just got out of prison. If he’s on the run he’s going to need some help.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And, and while you do that I’m going to duck inside. I feel a quick pick calling my name.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you serious?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Two minutes, okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Two minutes to fritter away your unborn child’s future?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Frittering? Or investing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, this is Detective Esposito. I need to put out a BOLO on a Jimmy Wolfins- Never mind. I think I found him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Jimmy! Hey!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come here!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’re you running to, pal?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey! See? I knew this place was lucky.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: C’mon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See that man? That is a bad man. He’s gonna confess and we’re going to know just who you are.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle? Mind if I try again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Course. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll just … wait outside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No problem.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You did that on purpose, didn’t you? High five. Good job.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Wolfinsky, do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: JIMMY
utterance.content: I’ve never seen him before in my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? I think he looks a lot like your old partner. The one who left you to get busted at that bank job seven years ago.

utterance.speaker: JIMMY
utterance.content: Doesn’t ring a bell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a grownup lying. Get used to that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Must’ve ate at you, huh? All those nights in the joint, knowing you were in there rotting away while he was out there, free. Because he ditched you at the bank.

utterance.speaker: JIMMY
utterance.content: Like I told the DA, I didn’t have a partner. And if I did, I ain’t no rat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about a murderer?

utterance.speaker: JIMMY
utterance.content: Cam’s dead?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you do know him.

utterance.speaker: JIMMY
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, but I had nothing to do with this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The day you made parole he installs a security system, gets all new locks. Now why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: JIMMY
utterance.content: Because … I don’t know, when I was convicted I may have told some folks that Cam would pay. But that was years ago. Look, the truth is, I was the one who messed up that day. I got hung up inside. Cam waited as long as he could. Longer than he should’ve. I told him that. He knew we were square.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Witnesses at Cam’s work say otherwise. Said you were fighting. That afterwards Cam was scared to come back to the garage at night.

utterance.speaker: JIMMY
utterance.content: What? No. That’s – I’m trying to get my life together like he did. I thought maybe he could put in a word with his boss, help me get a job driving.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well that’s funny. Because witnesses say that the conversation was heated.

utterance.speaker: JIMMY
utterance.content: Because he wouldn’t help me. Told me he couldn’t be around me anymore. That that part of his life was over. After I kept my mouth shut all those years, he couldn’t even put in a good word? That’s the last I saw of him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Wolfinsky, where were you last night?

utterance.speaker: JIMMY
utterance.content: I was with my girlfriend out in Jersey. I’ve been with her all week.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about this morning between 6 and 7?

utterance.speaker: JIMMY
utterance.content: We were having breakfast at a diner. People saw us. Look, I swear this wasn’t me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have you ever seen this baby before?

utterance.speaker: JIMMY
utterance.content: No. What’s a baby have to do with this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, he’s telling the truth. According to his girlfriend’s roommate he spent the last two days at their apartment in Jersey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And a waitress at that diner places him there during the shooting window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, if Jimmy was telling the truth then Cam didn’t have any reason to be afraid of him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And why was he avoiding the limo garage at this 3AM lunch break?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he wasn’t avoiding it. Maybe something else was going on. Most limo companies use GPS services to track their vehicles. Maybe they can tell us where Cam was going all those nights.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: SANDRA WHITMAN
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me. Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: SANDRA
utterance.content: Hi. Sandra Whitman, child services. Sorry it took me so long to get here. This time of year is always bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no. Not a problem. He’s right in the lounge.

utterance.speaker: SANDRA
utterance.content: Great. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … what’s going to happen to him?

utterance.speaker: SANDRA
utterance.content: County facilities don’t currently have any beds, so we’re working to find a foster family to take him. I’ll let you know as soon as we do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know if we should just be handing him over to strangers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we were strangers until this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you be logical in the face of that face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, because I have to be. I mean, we don’t know what’s going to happen to Cosmo. We can’t get attached.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that why you won’t hold him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Okay, fine. I’ve never really been a baby person. I mean, some people see babies and they want to hold them, they want to nibble their toes. I’ve never been one of those people, so …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. I did not know that about you. I suppose you hate rainbows, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t hate babies, Castle. I just don’t see the appeal. But I am sure I’ll feel differently when we have one of our own.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Will you. Will you?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, so we pulled GPS information from the past six nights Cameron was at work and nothing out of the ordinary.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Until we took a look at his lunch hour. Check it out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Every night at 3AM he would go off shift and he would drive here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Colfax building downtown.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But he wouldn’t stay long. Watch.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Every night he would drive to the same destination. A block in Alphabet City.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Each night he would take a different route. And he would do it over and over again.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Only one reason I could think why someone like him would be doing something like that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was practicing escape routes. Cam was back in the life. He was planning a getaway.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We scrubbed traffic cam footage from the Colfax building between the time Cameron left his house that night and the time he arrived at the church.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We found this behind the Colfax building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s his car.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Two guys are with him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 3:57AM. Where are they going with that briefcase?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t know, but about 15 minutes later –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here they come. Same briefcase. It’s a heist. And Cam is the wheelman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s in the building?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: High end offices, a jewelry store, real estate and law offices, the TV station, and a couple of banks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I checked the blotter, there are no reports of any break-ins at anyone at that address.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well they might not know they had been hit. Is there any evidence of the baby in the footage?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nope, only three men and a mustang.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So where did Cosmo come from?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Must be from wherever Cameron was between 4:12AM and when he was shot at 6:30. Canvass the area in Alphabet City where Cameron’s practice routes ended. See if you can figure out where those guys were holed up. Castle and I’ll head down to the Colfax building. Someone down there must know what these guys took.

utterance.speaker: DENNIS
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Detective. As head of security I checked with all our tenants. As far as we can tell, nothing was taken.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing? Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Mr. Dennis, how’s your security system?

utterance.speaker: DENNIS
utterance.content: State of the art. Good camera coverage. Motion detectors. We doubled checked all our systems. No wires were cut, no alarms were triggered, no elevators were called. There’s just no evidence of anyone entering the building.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then how do you explain this? Two masked guys entering your parking lot at 4AM.

utterance.speaker: DENNIS
utterance.content: I don’t know. It’s possible they never got past the parking gate and just gave up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Still, we’re going to need examine all the surveillance from last night, Mr. Dennis.

utterance.speaker: DENNIS
utterance.content: Sure. I’ll also get you a list of our tenants if you want to follow up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A heist where nothing was taken. Maybe this is a classic ‘no honor among thieves’ situation. You know, a heist goes wrong, they fight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where someone gets shot running away with a baby?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A not so classic no honor among thieves situation?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I mean, earlier just got me thinking. Our baby’s due in a month and I can’t stop it. What if I’m really not ready?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, you’re not ready.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nobody is. Look, being a dad is like being a cop. No matter what they teach you in the academy, you learn on the streets. You did okay with that, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … my first day I was so nervous I rear ended the spot man and the guys in vests poured out ready to take me out with extreme prejudice.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well … you care. That already makes you a hundred times better than the dad I had. This is it. This is where Cam’s route ended.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Espo. Check it out. A bullet hole.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Boom.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Building’s scheduled to be torn down at the end of the month.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Making this the perfect hideout.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Over here. We think this is where Cam’s killer fired from.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that powder residue?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Probably broke the window with his elbow before firing down on Cameron.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This building is about a five minute drive to that church.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something caught fire here recently. Very recently.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s also signs of a fight. Blood spatter on the wall. Don’t know whose.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And … found this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cosmo was here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘kay, so this must be where Cameron got him from. What was a baby doing here in the first place? Get CSU down here. Have them tear this place apart. Prints, trace, anything that’ll help us identify whoever else was involved.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I just keep wondering whose blood that was on the wall of the hideout. Every time I think about it I don’t like how the story ends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well I’ve contacted every business in the Colfax building. No thefts and no missing babies.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. We took another look at Jimmy Wolfinsky. If he is involved we can’t find a connection.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I spoke to Cameron’s wife again. There’s no indication of any new friends in his life. But they were having money issues. They were on the verge of losing their house, so odds are whatever he was doing was for the money.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But there was nothing unusual in his phone records and no activity that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, CSU’s just getting started and we’re not going to learn anything ‘til tomorrow, so –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Good night, guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We should probably get going too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, even though he’d been shot, Cameron did everything he could to keep the baby safe. That doesn’t seem like the actions of a bad guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, he’s probably not a bad guy. He just made a bad choice and got in over his head. Now c’mon. Let’s go home.

utterance.speaker: SANDRA
utterance.content: Shhh… it’s okay. It’s okay. Shh… hush, hush, hush.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh… what’s wrong, Cosmo?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re still here?

utterance.speaker: SANDRA
utterance.content: Yeah. I’ve been trying to locate a foster family but because it’s Thanksgiving week no one is available. I’m going to have to bring him to the county crisis center until I can find someone who can take him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you said they didn’t have any beds.

utterance.speaker: SANDRA
utterance.content: When it’s this crowded they have to double up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s no other options?

utterance.speaker: SANDRA
utterance.content: That’s the only place that can take an infant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, what if we take him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait … what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we’ve already bonded. I got all his stuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle. I told you –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know, I know. You haven’t been around babies that much. Not a big deal. I got this. I’m the baby whisperer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, she’s not gonna just give you a baby. I’m sure there are background checks and forms that we have to fill out, right?

utterance.speaker: SANDRA
utterance.content: Not … if the baby officially remains in the custody of the NYPD. And you guys have done an amazing job so far.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you say, Beckett? Wanna have a baby?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on! It’ll be fun. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is so not fun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if this is a part of your plan to turn me into a baby person it’s not working.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It isn’t. Well, it was. At first. But – he was so good at the precinct.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought you were the baby whisperer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am. There’s something wrong with this baby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, okay. It says here that gently bouncing your baby should calm him or her down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have an idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shh…. shh. Anything you want, okay buddy? You just tell me and I will give it to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here. Sit. Bounce.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, it’s working.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. You’re a genius.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do not laugh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not laughing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You do not laugh. Get me the towel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here, take him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon. Thank you. There we go. There we go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey! Here we go -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not on the rug.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. We’re gonna go on the chair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not on the chair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Put him on the blanket. I hate that blanket.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re going on the nasty blanket. Yeah. Okay. Good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hold him or he’ll roll off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, yes. Castle, I think he needs a change of clothes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … get him undressed and I’ll get a onesie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay … changing … changing… and a new diaper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, switch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here. Okay. Wipes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lotion.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Diaper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Onsie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And … … victory. We’ve done it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. You hold him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There we go. I’ll take care of this. Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uncle Rick’s pretty funny, huh? I think you’re pretty funny, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Now all we have to do is get him to sleep.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh, you are a hungry boy. Yes you are. Good for you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, well… look who’s up.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How long have I been gone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Coffee’s not even helping.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d forgotten about this part.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa. You two look like you got hit by the milk truck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You see this face? This is the face of your future.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That bad, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no. We slept like babies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, up every hour.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Where is the little guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha and Alexis offered to babysit him. They said they were going to make a day out of it. So .. where are we on … um …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Child services?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: … child services.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Still no reports of a missing baby, but while you two were bouncing junior on your knee CSU reports came in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoever was there cleaned up after themselves. The place was wiped down for prints.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about that fire?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Analysis of the burn showed high concentration of nitrocellulose and camphor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Charred celluloid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just like on Cameron.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That blood we found? According to genetic markers, came from someone related to that baby.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But without anything else to go on, all we know is that they are related. We still don’t know who either of them are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Cameron? He must have known.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We rechecked his phone, friends, and financials. Whatever was going on he hid it well.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And since no one in that office building knows what our thieves were after we’re back at square one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe not.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you thinking?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, given how much baby garbage we generated in just one night and given how quickly they cleaned and vacated that apartment after the shooting, I’m wondering where all their garbage went.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You always take me to the most exotic places.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you didn’t want to jump in your could have waited on the side like you usually do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? After the puke storm I put you through last night? It felt wrong not to participate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which, by the way, you were great last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. You weren’t so bad yourself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I was no baby whisperer. You know, I’ve gotta say, when I volunteered to take Cosmo I – I thought I was doing it for his benefit, but … I

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, okay. Okay, I get it. You were thinking that …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, tell you what. When the time comes, there’s no way I’m going to let you take care of our baby on your own.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Diapers. The same kind that Cosmo was wearing when we found him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The cheap, un-biodegradable kind? Now that’s just criminal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What else is in the bag?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A wine preservation kit. With uh … oh, argon canisters.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ping pong balls, paddles, and a net.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ping pong balls. Those are made of celluloid. Highly flammable. That’s what caused the burn.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? They were lighting ping pong balls on fire?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, get the balls to CSU. See if they can pull prints.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey look. A receipt. From three days ago for the diapers from a quick mart. The person paid cash.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does it have a time stamp?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Here it is. 2:47PM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And there’s our buyer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon … turn your head.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, c’mon. Damn it. Okay, a wine preservation kit, a missing baby, and a heist where nothing was taken. I mean, each time we find a piece of this puzzle it makes less and less sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s something we’re missing. Something that –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s time! It’s time!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - something that’ll make the pieces fit.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Quiet everyone. It’s starting!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wow man, how many of these things did you buy –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Shhh. Baby needs an education.

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA VAIL
utterance.content: Hello, I’m Miranda Vail and this is the 5 State Magic Ball Lottery. We have the largest pot in 5 State history.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That something we’re missing. I think we just found it.

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: - million dollars. Let’s see if there’s a winner out there. You could be next. Are you ready for your dreams to come true?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: Here we go. 40.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER HARRISON
utterance.content: I’ve got that.

utterance.speaker: HARRISON
utterance.content: Another one.

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: 37. And the magic ball number is …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No way.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How’d you know that, Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s Cameron’s lottery ticket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And it’s motive. Esposito, you said that there was a TV station in the Colfax building?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, WQTI.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. The break in where nothing was stolen? Ping pong balls, wax, gas? You guys, it makes perfect sense. They fixed the lottery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It wasn’t a heist, it was an exchange.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They replaced the official lotto balls with the doctored ones, which is why no one knew anything was missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They must have filled their balls with argon gas, sealing the holes with wax. Under the hot lights of the TV studio, the argon would make the balls expand enough they wouldn’t go in the chute. They would just bounce off.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So only the balls without gas could fit through.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. They must have been doing tests, exposing the gas filled balls to heat sources and gotten them too close. And celluloid is flammable –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s how the fire started.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It all fits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And there’s one sure way to prove it.

utterance.speaker: DEAN SEAHORN
utterance.content: No. No. No, this is impossible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And yet …

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: You don’t understand. This can’t happen. The balls are hand delivered and locked in sealed briefcases by the lottery commission. They’re placed in a safe that only two people have access to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what happens to the briefcase between the safe and the studio?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: One briefcase is chosen at random between nine identical cases just before the drawing. The balls are then removed from the case, weighed, measured, and then placed inside the machine by people wearing rubber gloves, making this a statistical impossibility. The odds against this are like –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Winning the lottery?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The case that they had with them at the time was only large enough to fit one set of balls. You said that the set that you use is chosen at random. Who makes that choice?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Our lottery announcer. Miranda Vail. But she’s been with us for 10 years. She’d never do something like that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does she have any children?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Yeah. A baby boy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How old?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: Maybe three months?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is she right now?

utterance.speaker: DEAN
utterance.content: She said she wasn’t feeling well. She just left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you stay here. That’s evidence. Watch those balls.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not touching it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Miranda! Miranda Vail?

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I’m in a hurry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just wait, we need to talk.

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: I can’t. Please. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have your baby.

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: You have him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: You have Benny?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: Oh my God, where is he? Is he okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s safe.

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: What about my husband, Paul? They have him, too.

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: They called me three days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: A man. They said they were holding Paul, my husband, and Benny, and that if I went to the police or said anything to anyone that he would kill them both.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did you recognize his voice?

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: It was disguised. He told me if I wanted to see my family again I had to do exactly as he said.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what did he tell you to do?

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: He said it was easy. All I had to do was pick the right set of balls. He would call me the morning of the lottery and tell me which one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he?

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: Yesterday at 5AM he told me to pick the third briefcase from the left. And that if his numbers didn’t come up that I would be sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you hear anything else? Anything in the background?

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: No. All I heard was Benny crying. When do I get to see him? Is he here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s on his way in right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One more thing I still don’t get. When they came forward to collect their winnings you would know who they were. How were they planning on getting away with it?

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: They were going to hold Paul and Benny another couple of days until they could collect their winnings. Once they’d moved the money out of the country they were going to release them. But now … do you think you can find him?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: If Paul’s still a hostage, he won’t be for long. Whatever happened that night with his captors, their plan is blown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not necessarily. We checked with lottery officials. A second ticket with the exact same numbers was sold in the city just hours after Cameron’s body was found.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: A replacement ticket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They might not know we made the connection to the lottery. After all, Miranda did as she was asked, so … they may still come forward.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What if they decide that it’s too risky? What if they discover that they know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then Paul Vail will be nothing but a liability and they will kill him.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then we need to find them before that happens.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU’s going over Cam’s car again, see if his partners left any trace evidence, but it’s going to take time.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Time is one thing we don’t have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And we’re facing an uphill battle. Whoever these guys are they must have been damn good to get past that building’s security undetected.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. What if they didn’t?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We already know they have one person working on the inside of the Colfax building, Miranda. But what if they have two?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They would have needed someone to help they circumvent the building’s security system, avoid the camera, and rewrite all the logs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The only person capable of doing that undetected –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - is the head of security.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He works in the building. We spoke to him. We may have already tipped our hand.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Not if he’s being leveraged. What do we know about him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Walter Dennis. Guy’s an ex-cop from Albany.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Any family, spouse, or children they can use against him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. Guy’s divorced and no kids.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Listen to this. Dennis got fired from the Albany police department ten years ago for taking bribes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s dirty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They’re not leveraging him. He’s in on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If he’s in on it then he knows we’re on to him. He would have seen us taking Miranda.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They can’t come forward now. They’re going to kill Paul.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dennis isn’t at work. He left right after we did.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He isn’t at his apartment, either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, he’s wherever Paul is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, check this out. I found a series of calls between Walter Dennis and Roman’s Limo Service.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where Cameron worked.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dennis called there six times.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Probably to plan the job.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Only they weren’t to Cam. These were made in the last two days.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: After Cam was already dead, so –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who was he calling?

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: C’mon, let’s go. It’s clear.

utterance.speaker: THUG
utterance.content: C’mon. Let’s get out.

utterance.speaker: DENNIS
utterance.content: C’mon Vail. Time’s up.

utterance.speaker: DENNIS
utterance.content: C’mon! Get him in there. Get him in.

utterance.speaker: ROMAN
utterance.content: Sorry, pal. But with the way things stand we’ve got no choice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think you do.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: C’mon. On your knees.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I never thought I’d see you again. Where’s Benny?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He’s on his way up now. Nicely done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks. But uh … Cam is the real hero here.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The getaway driver?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Turns out it was a case of honor among thieves.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Paul told us the whole story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When Cam’s boss, Roman, found out about his past, he pressured Cam into the job and threatened to fire him if he didn’t go along.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was going to destroy everything he and his wife were trying to build.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Roman promised no one would get hurt, but then after the ball exchange at the TV station, Cam overheard Roman and Walter Dennis talking. They whole leaving the country thing was bull. They never had any intention of letting the Vails live.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. After collecting the winnings, they were going to stage an accident, killing them all.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Silencing the only witnesses to their crime.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When Cam found out, he couldn’t live with that.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: He tried to save us both, but they caught him. So he grabbed Benny and ran. He gave up his life for us.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Look who’s here.

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: Benny, oh my God.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: My grandmother got him some new clothes.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Hey buddy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, the good news is, I mean, besides saving that family, they are rolling over the lottery. So I’ve got another shot at that $247 million. All I’ve got to do is tape my tickets back together.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh … dude. They uh … they already took out the trash.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s – I’m just going to let him swim around in a dumpster for like a hour, then I’m going to pull him out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Happy Thanksgiving.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you too.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MIRANDA
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I think I’m actually going to miss little Benny.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, who knows. Maybe in a few Thanksgivings from now we’ll have a couple Bennys of our own running around.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, if you guys have kids in a few years, and I have kids in a few years, they can grow up together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And … it’s ruined.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the turkey will be too, if we don’t get it out of the freezer. Come one, ladies. Chop chop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There we go.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, this is so exciting. Our family is just growing by leaps and bounds. If we keep this up, darling, we’re going to need a bigger table.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly twenty minutes ‘til turkey time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Pi is on his way and Beckett’s dad just called. He’ll be here any minute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excellent. And where’s Beckett?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Katherine … what on Earth are you wearing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My … outfit. Your family tradition?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah … uh .. you do know I was kidding about that, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I actually wasn’t sure about that. So I figured, if this isn’t a Castle family tradition, then maybe it should be. Better put this on, pilgrim.
